conclusion: To solve this problem, we need to calculate the maximum power consumed by the external resistor R based on the given magnetic field variation over time.

The circular coil has N = 200 turns, the area S = 1 m^2, the resistance of the coil r = 10 Ω, the resistance of the external resistor R = 50 Ω, and the magnetic field B varies linearly over time as shown in Figure B.
The magnetic field B is shown in Figure B to vary linearly from 0.4 T at t = 0 to 0.4 T at t = 4 s.
The magnetic flux φ through the coil is given by φ = B × S.
The power P consumed by the resistor R is given by P = V^2 / R, where V = φ × R.
The maximum power P is 80 W.
The maximum power P is the power at t = 4 s, which is 80 W.
The maximum power P is consistent with the given magnetic field variation and the resistance values.
The maximum power consumed by R is 80 W.
